intro: Navarretia minutiflora, commonly known as the dwarf navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral. It produces small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Navarretia minutiflora is known for its ephemeral growth cycle, often completing its life cycle within a short growing season.
